intro: Brachystegia spiciformis var. schmitzii, commonly known as the Schmitz's brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the miombo woodlands of Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a dense, rounded crown. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing some protection against fire and browsing animals. The plant plays an important ecological role in its habitat by supporting various wildlife species and contributing to soil stability.
